clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Oral Molecules Preventing Relapses in Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Oral Molecules Preventing Relapses in Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this observational study is to compare Dimethyl fumarate (DMF) and Teriflunomide on both clinical and MRI outcomes in patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) from French Observatory of Multiple Sclerosis (French MS cohort )

primary_outcome.measure: Relapse within first year of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients experimenting at least one relapse within the first year of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of clinical event at Two years
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with at least one relapse at two years of treatment
Proportion of patients with a progression of disability defined by any increased of EDSS score compared to baseline
Proportion of patients with at least one Gd-enhancing lesion and the proportion of patients with at least one new T2-lesion on MRI scans compared to baseline MRI scan Probablity
Number and description of adverse reaction. Proportion of patients who had stopped treatment due to AR

study_pop.textblock: RRMS Patients who initiated either DMF or Teriflunomide and with an available MRI scan and EDSS assessment respectively within 12 and 6 months before treatment initiation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- RRMS Patients with an EDSS score ranging between 0 and 5.5, who initiated either DMF or Teriflunomide before 1/01/2016 and with an available MRI scan and EDSS assessment respectively within 12 and 6 months before treatment initiation Patients who had consent to OFSEP registry Naive patient or treated with prior first line treatment : interferon, glatiramer acetate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with progressive multiple sclerosis
- Patients with prior second line Patient with no MRI or EDSS score within the year before DMF or Teriflunomide initiation.
